name: pascal
text: A comment left by pascal was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Jesus, Dwilow, Appers)

name: bookofsand
text: Isn't that Ray's "I just nailed a social worker" crown?

name: catachresis
text: Yes and yes.

name: nurdbot
text: I bet he took one of the cardboard ones from Burger King, and somehow made it more awesome.

name: cailetshadow
text: Ray sees nothing wrong with asking for one of these crowns from Burger King and going home to glue real rubies onto it.

name: dorothypoopbot
text: and mink fur, apparently.

name: johnnybaverage
text: That is basically the essence of Ray.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Useta cut em jagged and wear them grey side out in an attempt to emulate Jughead Jones

name: kenyot
text: I wouldn't be surprised if found and purchased an actual crown on Ebay Platinum Reserve .

name: hoarday4
text: Dude this is Ray we're talking about, he probably ebayed an ancient, priceless, heirloom crown by accident.

name: lastlarf
text: I love the way this refferences a strip posted almost three years previously.

name: lastlarf
text: Hah. Ok, that didn't work. Try this

name: catachresis
text:
And also another strip, which I'm too fucked to reference ("Does he always wear a crown after he gets mad rutty?")
And who, indeed, was the mad ruttee?

name: heath
text:
I believe you're talking about the confusion with Little Nephew's pants/underwear situation

[URL="http://achewood.com/index.php?date=10142003"]pants/underwear situation[/URL]

name: laserblade
text: Cornelius, duh.

name: pogo
text: Yes, I definitely remembered the "I'm not afraid of the poilce now" line.  A clasic.

name: cracklewater
text:
Tequila making a person keen on fighting with police has been one of my favourite recurring recurring memes since that strip.
Lyle has been the subject at least once (when they considered replacing his mezcal with something nicer), possibly more.

name: cracklewater
text: Here too: http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua4p9x4m

name: catachresis
text: Also, Cornelius drinks Pimms. As someone who is around a place where people drink The Pimms Drink (Pimms No. 1 cup mixed with fruit and lemonade) I do very much wonder if anyone drinks it neat. They would probably be a fool to do so, as it is not designed that way. In fact, it is much out of Cornelius' character to do so. Oh well.

name: heccibiggs
text: I figured that by saying he was drnking Pimms, it was implied that it was mixed with lemonade and fruit or whatever. I mean, that's what me and all my lot call it.

name: i_love_kate
text: Yeah but in that case it would be nowhere close to 50 proof.

name: mattfish
text: A pimms cup is indeed Pimms No. 1 mixed with lemon soda or pretty much anything, but Cornelius would probably drink it neat just as well yeah i mean it's pretty tasty

name: w_w
text: Shouldn't Pimm's Cup be served in a pint glass? Anyhow, I'm impressed that Ray even realized that he was drinking alcohol. That's a discriminating palate right there.

name: bazookaradio
text: I gots ta get me a crown for just such a purpose. I think my wife would take it as a compliment(?)

name: epicurus
text: I love how fear of the police is used as a criteria for evaluating the effects of drink. That is rad.

name: ssddr
text: Its definitly in referance to this old old strip.

name: epicurus
text: Oh, also Ray's expression "using a Program." is EXTREMELY classic.

name: jonnay
text: Guy's, I've been thinking about downloading a Program, is it any good?

name: bixschmix
text: Just download it and it gets all the problems away.

name: boredom_man
text: That is not true. I am using a Program and my keyboard is still wet.

name: mr_lostman28
text: man that is gross. that is dog shit.

name: scriblerus
text: "I was sad and scared" is my most-used Achewood quote.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Don't forget it's more recent counterpart: "I was rude and walkin'"

name: fineoakstructure
text:
"RAD and walkin'"

Sorry, I was posting at work and with much haste.

name: epicurus
text: Quit stealing my bit.

name: nonstopdancer
text: 5 for the crown

name: peterjoel
text: chubby for the curious orange

name: i_love_kate
text: Chubby for opening old emotional wounds.

name: nikopol
text: Ray's internal organs are basically an inverted distillery.

name: cherubrocker22
text: We should all wear crowns while computing. It will encourage us to only use the computer when it's actually important, minimizing "clicking/dicking around" time and increasing productivity.

name: heccibiggs
text: Damn Pimms is so good. Such an awesome drink for the summer. Is it not very common in the Americas? I guess it's kind of a middle class British thing, but I'm not middle class and I still manage to enjoy it. Hell of refreshing.

name: pogo
text: Never even heard of it.  Sounds gay.  "Pimms" in your buttocks, mate."

name: perilon
text:
Crap, I lamed you instead of clicking reply. Crappity crappity crap.

I was going to say, I had to Wikipedia this drink, and it told me it is drunk at such a thing as a, "regatta?" And a Pimm's No. 1 cup is infused with "borage leaves." These are also things I have not heard of in "the Americas." Or to be offensively narcissistic, in "THE America."

name: godfatherofsouls
text: in canada its not unheard of but they'll do anything to seem less american

name: tonyhighwind
text:
I think our thing over here is Long Island Iced Teas.

I have to say that I have never quite understood why you would drink alcohol in order to be refreshed. I, like many people, drink it solely to influence my behavior around pigs bobbies Law Enforcement.

name: tonyhighwind
text: That last bit doesn't quite come across.  What I am saying is that if booze is headed down my gullet, it is making me less and less afraid of the police as it goes on the journey.

name: fiftyshekels
text: I had my first Pimm's cup last night, at a brand new pub-- first time I've ever seen Pimm's on a bar list. This place made it with muddled mint, Sprite, and a cucumber spear. delicious

name: ahatofpig
text: He will be using a Program to make the drawing.

name: redsalesperson
text: If anybody is still curious as to whether or not it would be possible to lower one's BAC by consuming an alcoholic beverage, it would be, but only if your BAC is higher than the alcohol content of the drink. In this example, Ray's BAC would have to be 25% (50 proof). While this would kill any normal being, its effect on Ray cannot be known.

name: zathyr
text: The line "I'm serious, blog" almost makes me want to start a blog so I can use that line somewhere in the blog that I would make.

name: prettyrad
text:
Ray can imagine such a thing.

This is possibly the only Achewood where every panel has hell of comedy. The last panel in particular; Ray's blogging is always hilarious. Fives all round!

name: evilbobikus
text: Afraid of the police is now the question I ask people to gauge drunkenness

name: chexmix
text: The phrase "using a Program" makes this, especially the initial cap on "Program."

name: treatyofparis
text: A seriously classic voicing of Ray.
